publicationStmt.p: published electronically as part of the TLS project at https://hxwd.org

sourceDesc.p: Created by members of the TLS project

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: They used wine fermented nine times, with the sacrificial animals.

sense.def: ox, sheep, and pig used for sacrifice; suovetaurilia

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: It was called strong wine,

sense.def: a kind of strong wine made to ferment by the addition of old wine

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: or "full-bodied wine".

sense.def: a kind of strong wine made to ferment by the addition of old wine

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: or "full-bodied wine".

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: It was the same for pryers to ask for rain.

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: It was the same for pryers to ask for rain.

sense.def: ask for; beg for; request a thing N

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: It was the same for pryers to ask for rain.

sense.def: standard procedure; standard preferred method, standard technique

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: and the bristles were all from the hair of autumn hares

sense.def: fine long hair, primarily on animals, but by extension also used to refer to human hair

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: and the bristles were all from the hair of autumn hares

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: and the bristles were all from the hair of autumn hares

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: The official Lu Hu made them.

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: The official Lu Hu made them.

sense.def: make/produce/reproduce (physically), construct, build (a platform, a house)

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: Under the Han system,

sense.def: established system; basic rules; principled systematic practice; French: régime

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: the emperor's low table was jade.

sense.def: read jī: small table, low table

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: the emperor's low table was jade.

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: the emperor's low table was jade.

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: Elephant ivory was used for small braziers

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: which were decorated with flower patterns.

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: They used wine to grind ink

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: and jade inkstones

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: a western domain presented him with a jiguang [a mythical beast, "lucky shining"] fur garment.

sense.def: fur coat (often but not always of high quality, preferably light), the fur of which always turned outwards rather than inwards

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: a western domain presented him with a jiguang [a mythical beast, "lucky shining"] fur garment,

sense.def: elaborate garment (worn by Han emperor Wu when holding court)

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: The emperor often wore this garment when he held court.

sense.def: from time to time> sometimes; often; periodically; several times; at regular intervals; all the time

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: The emperor often wore this garment when he held court.

sense.def: elaborate garment (worn by Han emperor Wu when holding court)

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: The emperor often wore this garment when he held court.

seg.line: 高帝戚夫人善鼓瑟擊筑

tls:text.tls:srcline: 高帝戚夫人善鼓瑟擊筑

sense.def: excel at V-ing; be good at V-ing

tls:text.tls:srcline: 高帝戚夫人善鼓瑟擊筑

sense.def: thirteen-stringed lute with large head, played with a bamboo plastron

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: In the rear palace, when they all sang together,

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: the sound would reach the heavens.

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: Lady Qi had rings made of god refined a hundred times,

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: Lady Qi had rings made of god refined a hundred times,

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: Lady Qi had rings made of god refined a hundred times,

sense.def: ring of jade or of gold in which the radius of the hole in the middle is the same as the breadth of the ring. (In the case of the bì 璧 the diameter is the same.)

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: Lady Qi had rings made of god refined a hundred times,

tls:line.title: Translation of 西京雜記 into (English)

tls:text.tls:line: but later it was changed to "Fish and Water-Plant Palace".
